intro: Collinsia monticola, commonly known as the mountain checkerspot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in some regions.
